Under these circumstances Mithridates reconquered almost the whole , of his kingdom, and pressed severely upon Cappadocia, inasmuch as Lucullus did not stir‚ under the pretext that Glabrio was close at hand, and ,the' latter did not come to the rescue. At first indeed he had marched with all speed, hoping to snatch the victory out of the hands of Lucullus, but when he heard how the case stood, he took no steps to assume the command of the army of Lucullus, but remained idly in his province of Bithynia.
